geodesicparams.ellipsefitting.helper_functions package

Submodules

geodesicparams.ellipsefitting.helper_functions.normalise_2d_pts module

Procedure that translates and normalises a set of 2D homogeneous points so that their centroid is at the origin and their mean distance from the origin is sqrt(2).

This process typically improves the conditioning of any equations used to solve homographies, fundamental matrices etc.

geodesicparams.ellipsefitting.helper_functions.normalise_2d_pts.norm_2d_pts(pts)[source]

Translates and normalises a set of 2D homogeneous points so that their centroid is at the origin and their mean distance from the origin is sqrt(2).

Parameters:

pts (matrix) – A 3xN mpmath matrix of 2D homogeneous coordinates.

Returns:

  • newpts (matrix) – A 3xN mpmatrix of transformed 2D homogeneous coordinates. The scaling parameter is normalised to 1 unless the point is at infinity.

  • t (matrix) – The 3x3 transformation matrix (newpts = t * pts).
